lines.text:
[Arthur is conversing with the ghost of Hobson]
Arthur, I've seen your son.

[Arthur, inebriated, looks stricken]
Oh!
I've told him all about you. But he still wants to meet you very much.
Ah, old man, you're not playing fair!
Weren't we happy, Arthur?
Of course. Then we met.
[to Arthur]
If projectile vomiting ever becomes an Olympic event, you would do your country proud.
What can I do Hobson? I mean what would you do if you were me?
The word "bathe" comes to mind.
Yesterday I sold some blood at a hospital.
Hospital? I should've thought a local distillery would have paid you much more.
Mr. Bach?
Bitterman! How the hell are you?
Sir, what are you doing here?
They said I'd never make it Bitterman, they said the city would eat me alive. But now look at me, I got my own pail and my own squeegee, I showed them ALL!
Arthur?
Martha!
Arthur, what are you doing?
Well, I was...
Are you going to marry Susan Johnson or not?
I already told you Martha, I can't!
Enough is enough, Arthur. Marry the bitch!
You marry her Martha!
Where's Mrs. Bach? Is she...
Madam awoke early. She had some phone calls to make.
Ah. Ah, well in that case, put on one of her nightgowns and come in here, would you?
Sir?
Oh, come on, Fairchild. I know you want it. I've seen the way you look at me.

[Fairchild heads towards the closet]
Hey! Fairchild, I'm kidding! I'm kidding. God, it's the truth. Don't they ever kid each other on your planet?
